alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 7:49PM MDT until June 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Logan, Morgan and Washington Counties. South Platte River at Atwood affecting Logan County. South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. South Platte River near Weldona affecting Weld and Morgan Counties. South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River near Weldona. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. At 10.0 feet, There is widespread lowland and meadow flooding. Irrigation works are impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM MDT Saturday, the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.9 feet by Sunday night. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
